com.thinkaurelius.titan.diskstorage.keycolumnvalue

Interface KeyColumnValueStoreManager

  • All Superinterfaces:
    StoreManager
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ExpectedValueCheckingStoreManager, InMemoryStoreManager, KCVSManagerProxy, MetricInstrumentedStoreManager, OrderedKeyValueStoreManagerAdapter, TTLKCVSManager

    public interface KeyColumnValueStoreManager
extends StoreManager
    KeyColumnValueStoreManager provides the persistence context to the graph database storage backend.

    A KeyColumnValueStoreManager provides transaction handles across multiple data stores that are managed by this KeyColumnValueStoreManager.

    Author:
    Matthias Bröcheler (me@matthiasb.com);

    • Method Detail

      • openDatabase

        default KeyColumnValueStore openDatabase(String name)
                                  throws BackendException
        Opens an ordered database by the given name. If the database does not exist, it is created. If it has already been opened, the existing handle is returned.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of database
        Returns:
        Database Handle
        Throws:
        BackendException

      • openDatabase

        KeyColumnValueStore openDatabase(String name,
                                 StoreMetaData.Container metaData)
                          throws BackendException
        Opens an ordered database by the given name. If the database does not exist, it is created. If it has already been opened, the existing handle is returned.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of database
        metaData - options specific to this store
        Returns:
        Database Handle
        Throws:
        BackendException

      • mutateMany

        void mutateMany(Map<String,Map<StaticBuffer,KCVMutation>> mutations,
                StoreTransaction txh)
         throws BackendException
        Executes multiple mutations at once. For each store (identified by a string name) there is a map of (key,mutation) pairs that specifies all the mutations to execute against the particular store for that key. This is an optional operation. Check StoreManager.getFeatures() if it is supported by a particular implementation.
        Parameters:
        mutations -
        txh -
        Throws:
        BackendException
